notesStmt.note: Some holes in the paper due to ink corrosion; some folios repaired with white paper towards the spine
Musical notation is written from left to right, the lyrics follow this direction with words having been divided in syllables; each song is preceded by a number and the title
Square script for the titles; Semi-cursive script for the lyrics
Notes of production on most left bottom corners, reading "AL / Manuscript Music / No. 6" or the image of a sailing boat in a circle with the note "AL / No. 6"

msContents.summary: Shirat Ya'aqov - Gesänge für den israelitischen Gottesdienst für Solo und Chor componiert von Jacob Bachmann, Obercantor der isr. Cultusgemeinde in Odessa. It contains 79 Hebrew songs for solo voice and choir composed by hazzan Jacob Bachmann in Odessa. The music and lyrics are preceded by a title-page, a two-page German preface by the composer and a two-page content index with reference to the various liturgical songs. One needs a trained eye to be able to follow the Hebrew text in the score, since the lyrics have been written out syllable by right-to-left syllable to fit the left-to-right convention of sheet music.

msItem.title: Label: Presented by Mrs. Dorothy Elfin and Mr. and Mrs. Michael Dines in memory of Mr. Arthur Elfin, 1985
Title page reading: שירת יעקב Shirat Ya'aqov - Gesänge für den israelitischen Gottesdienst für Solo und Chor componiert von Jacob Bachmann, Obercantor der isr. Cultusgemeinde in Odessa.
Content Index with reference to various liturgical songs
Seventy-nine Hebrew songs for solo voice and choir composed by hazzan Jacob Bachmann in Odessa.
תם ונשלם ביום ה׳ פ׳ בהעלתך / בשנת תרעז לפק / בפה פאנטיפרידד אנגליה

supportDesc.foliation: Ink foliation in Arabic numerals, top outer corner of side a

decoDesc.decoNote: Unnumbered i rectoStamp: Arthur Elfin, / 33, Singleton Rd. / Salford 7. / Tel. Broughton 3688.
145bStamp: Arthur Elfin, / 33, Singleton Rd. / Salford 7. / Tel. Broughton 3688

binding.p: Modern binding; Spine: Gold-tooled lettering reading "SHIRAT / YAAKOV / Bachmann"

origin.p: Produced in Pontypridd, on the 5th, parashat Beha'alotkha (Numbers 8:1-12:16) (i.e. the weekly Torah reading read in the month of Siwan), of 677 [= Saturday 26-05-1917].

history.provenance: Handwritten label, Presented by Mrs. Dorothy Elfin and Mr. and Mrs. Michael Dines in memory of Mr. Arthur Elfin in 1985.
